byline.contributor: Adam Goldman, Scott Shane and David E. Sanger contributed reporting.
byline.original: By MARK MAZZETTI and ERIC LICHTBLAU

abstract: Central Intelligence Agency analysis concludes Russia deployed hackers to interfere with American presidential campaign with primary aim of making Donald J Trump president; Trump dismisses report, most consequential by American spy agency in years; compares report to botched 2002 conclusion that Saddam Hussein had weapons of mass destruction.
lead_paragraph: The conclusion that Russia intervened in the election to help Donald J. Trump was based on what many believe is overwhelming circumstantial evidence, which is often the most intelligence analysts have at their disposal.
snippet: The conclusion that Russia intervened in the election to help Donald J. Trump was based on what many believe is overwhelming circumstantial evidence, which is often the most intelligence analysts have at their disposal....

headline.main: C.I.A. Judgment on Russia Built on Swell of Evidence
headline.print_headline: C.I.A. Judgment on Russia Built on Swell of Evidence
